characters: WHAT ARE WE DOING TO DO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caption: Bethlehem Creek, Wyoming 10:19pm 28/07/47 The air is filled with the sounds of a warm, summer night light comes on in a FARMHOUSE window. The door opens, a s dog and a young girl emerge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on now Paul, don't be long. The dog trots out across the property. It stops to scratc The sounds of night cease. The dog stops scratching, snif the air, cocking its head, sensing something. We hear a l humming sounds. The dog looks up. We see a soft orange gl reflected in its eyes. The dog whimpers Back at the farmhouse, a deep, dull thud shakes the groun bringing the small girl back out onto the veranda. An ora glow pulsates somewhere out in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul... Paul? The girl draws near, illuminated by the orange glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul?! The glow fades again. MUSIC: "The Boy In The Bubble" by Paul Simon.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SAN DIEGO STREET. PRESENT
dialogues.text: GRAHAM WILLY (32) and CLIVE GOLLINGS (33) stand in the blazing San Diego sunshine, waiting to cross the road. GR is thin but his clothes seem too small. He has long greas hair, buck teeth and thick glasses. CLIVE is bigger and w a long black leather coat, Red Dwarf T-shirt and boots. H hair is densely curly and shaped like a pyramid. Four people dressed as BORG from Star Trek pass by. GRAHA and CLIVE shrug derisively. The cross-walk beeps. As the music kicks in, GRAHAM and CLIVE set off across th road towards the San Diego Convention Centre. They make t way through a throng of costumed Comic-Con attendees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE are at a fantasy weapons stand. CLIVE is brandishing a KATANA SWORD. He test the balance, the weig the sharpness. He closes one eye and looks down the lengt the blade. He nods appreciatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight. Practical performance. 100% Japanese, folded steel. Real hero shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE nods, puts the sword down and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you gonna get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's rubbish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see them on an escalator, walking down a wide corridor passing people in a variety of costumes. Finally, they jo line of people waiting to meet the actor, MICHAEL BIEHN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel that the killing of Hicks and Newt in Alien 3, invalidates Ripley's struggle at the closed of the previous installment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to ask that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough tits four eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, next! Suddenly nervous, GRAHAM approaches. MICHAEL BIEHN is sig pictures. He is pleasant, if business like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there. Who's it to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... are you... did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go. SECURITY moves GRAHAM on. CLIVE approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there. Who's it to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... are you... did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go. SECURITY moves CLIVE on. CLIVE scrambles for his camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I need to photograph him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take it from there. CLIVE and GRAHAM huddle together and try to position themselves with MICHAEL BIEHN in the background. CLIVE ta the shot. We see a frozen image of CLIVE and GRAHAM, with MICHAEL BIEHN barely visible in the background. The pair off, looking at their spoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was amazing. I was actually a bit nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good egg, wasn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, very unaffected. Damn, I forgot to give him my card. CLIVE points at SECURITY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to Colossus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. Hey, Rosario Dawson's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She NEEDS to call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE sit at a table fiddling nervously with p On either side of them are stacks of their new book; JELV ALIEN QUEEN OF THE VARVAK. A banner hangs behind, display the tome's cover, a muscular green woman in a gold bikini rides a blue rhino. She lashes at the beast with a laser whip. She has three tits. A lanky publicist paces up and down, making sure everything is in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks good, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really does the image justice. I never noticed the third tit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Graham's idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies man, huh? You guys happy? You got enough pens? You wanna Snapple? You wanna a Diet Coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a fat Coke please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fat what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you man a FAT Coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it so quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylar's doing a Q and A in the main pavillion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man! I wanted to go to that . I wanted to find out if he actually eats the brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can make a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll pick up when he's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. The hard work's done, we have a great story and as usual your renderings jump from the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah man. Three tits. Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we have to do now is sit back and enjoy. A child approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen Jelva welcomes thee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where Sylar's on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main pavillion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Hey, three tits. Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caption: 50 MINUTES LATER They are sat in exactly the same position as before. CLIV looks a little downbeat, GRAHAM fidgets with his pens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's the hour. How'd we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three copies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, one for each tit. Maybe you should have given her four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sweat it. It's a sleeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but three copies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than Carl Weathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nuts? My office is full of junk. The PUBLICIST walks away chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham, I need a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE are stood against the wall in a bar. GRA drinks and elaborate blue cocktail through a straw. CLIVE sips from a Jack Daniels and Coke. Everyone else in the b is dressed as a HOBBIT. CLIVE winks at a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE's hotel room is filled with bags of stuf from the convention, a laptop computer and a games consol plugged into the TV. GRAHAM lies on his bed. He is lookin a map. Other maps are scattered about.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It was like the Prancing Pony in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nasty Hobbitses. CLIVE emerges from the bathroom. He is naked but for a bl towel wrapped around his waist. His hair is wet and sudde incredibly long. Around his neck, a large animal tooth ha on a black leather cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think they're so cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, are you excited about going to Area 51?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 06.30 check out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-ffirmative. GRAHAM and CLIVE both look at their watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, two, one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beep. Beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Graham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Clive. They switch off their respective bedside lights. The room plunged into pitch darkness. A few seconds pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we try and storm the Citadel before we nod off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't hurt could it? We hear some movement then the room is illuminated by the The boys lie on their beds holding games controllers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE stand at reception. Both look extremely sleepy. CLIVE's eyes close. GRAHAM lolls forward onto the reception desk. His head hits the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys stand, waiting for their transport. We see them across the road. A tiny old car splutters up to the curb. valet gets out and hands the keys to CLIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's ours. A large RV pulls up. A 1985 Holiday Rambler, Imperial. To the range in its day. Still looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. GRAHAM and CLIVE run off toward the RV. The four BORG fro the previous day approach the VALET and exchange the key the car for some small change. The BORG drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Borg. (giving the finger) Assimilate this! The RV speeds past the disgruntled VALET. GRAHAM and CLIV can be heard whooping within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE is seated behind the wheel of their RV, he now wear black wrap-around shades. In the back of the RV, GRAHAM fusses with maps and provisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Java. Straight up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any solids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let's punch through. Miles make the eggs taste sweeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love eggs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear that. Now, get that "Joe' on the go and jump in the Chewie seat. I need your map skills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job I pre-pared. GRAHAM flicks on the coffee and jumps into the co-pilot's (Chewie) seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shame I don't have some controls on this side. That way, I could take over if you needed the loo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could say "take the helm."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Take the helm, number one."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, "take the helm, number one, I need a number two." They laugh heartily. Through this, GRAHAM has been taking his laptop and setting it up on the dash board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Least I've got Cerebro, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Real-time sat-nav multi map and advanced geo-tagging with continual info stream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And let's not forget, we've always got Analogue. GRAHAM pulls a map down. Obscuring the entire windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when we're driving Graham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. GRAHAM sends the map back up into the roller. The coffee percolator gurgles in the galley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like coffee o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god. I'm a wreck until I've had my first cup of J. GRAHAM high fives CLIVE and heads back into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE eat lunch. GRAHAM has finished a plate o prawns. He inspects the shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a pile of dead droids. A perky waitress approaches. GRAHAM and CLIVE become shy awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys all set? Can I get you anything else? GRAHAM spills his drink. CLIVE appears very uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RV
dialogues.text: They drive in silence, surveying the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing, isn't it? There are 295,734,134 people in this country and we haven't seen a soul for a hundred miles. Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that old woman on crutches we saw hitchhiking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apart from her. I suppose that's why they established the Dreamland facility out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far from prying eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know the site was selected in the mid-1950s for testing of the U-2 spyplane, due to its remoteness, proximity to existing facilities and presence of a dry lake bad for landings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we have a bite before or after we hit the Black Mailbox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE tuck into burgers. They are the only customers. The interior is replete with various Area 51 related memorabilia. PAT, (female, 50s) the proprietor, speaks to them from behind the counter. She holds up two bumper stickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Watch The Skies" or "Alien Onboard?" GRAHAM and CLIVE look at each other for a few seconds bef looking back at PAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Alien Onboard."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice choice. So, where have you boys come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Diego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comic-Con?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you tell? We see GRAHAM and CLIVE looking back at PAT. They look li the most painfully obvious Comic-Con attendees ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a guess. My nephew launched a comic down there a couple of years ago. Sort of dramatized the accounts of some of the folk we've had in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Encounter Briefs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. You heard of it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got all six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well whaddya know? Small world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you get a lot of UFO types round here? We see PAT looking back at CLIVE, surrounded by UFO and a paraphernalia, a slight smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A UFO? Oh, I've seen plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?! You've seen more than one UFOs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know what they were. So as far as I'm concerned they're unidentified and they were definitely flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And objects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight. Whether or not they were spaceships, I can't say. Probably not, but I'd like to think they were. Be a shame if we were the only souls in the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you now, it's estimated that there are as many as 200 billion galaxies in the observable universe and each of those has approximately 40 billion starts, around which orbit countless planets and moons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes you think though, don't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everybody? GRAHAM and CLIVE ponder this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys all set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like a cup of coffee please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing. How about you, sugar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have an E.T. malt please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna sparkler in that? GRAHAM smiles coyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that as a yes. She beams at the boys and disappears into the kitchen. GR and CLIVE are left alone. They take it all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice here, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I might use the loo. CLIVE walks through a door marked "Maliens'. The adjacen toilet door (GUS and JAKE) enter. GRAHAM becomes uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes dear, what can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE washes his hands. He pumps soap from a dispenser wh is shaped like an alien's head, the soap squirts out of i mouth. CLIVE is quite taken with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is absolutely amazing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE appears out of the toilet with his hands in the air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Graham, an alien just sicked up into my palms. CLIVE doesn't see the two men sat up at the counter. He strides over to GRAHAM, full of excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm joking, of course. They have a soap dispenser, shaped like an alien's head. When you pump his jaw, soap comes out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hilarious. GRAHAM flicks his eyes to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CLIVE looks over and sees the two men. They are glaring b CLIVE immediately loses his confident air.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Here it comes! GRAHAM closes his yes, remembering what he ordered. The t men turn to see PAT emerge from the kitchen with a tray o drinks. Two bottles of beer, one cup of coffee and an abs looking milkshake in a tall glass with a sparkler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then, beers for you gentleman. A cup of Joe and a extra thick malt with a sparkler for the boys from outer space. The man snigger derisively. PAT senses the tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where you boys headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're heading into Utah. Do ourselves some hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deer, coon, beaver, whatever steps in front of the bangstick, right Jake? They throw a look back at GRAHAM and CLIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right, Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now, I heard Utah beaver puts up quite a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we're counting on. They nudge each other and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better make you something good and hot. Long way to The Beehive. PAT give GRAHAM and CLIVE a look. CLIVE understands and fumbles for hi wallet.
He places a number of bills on the table. They leave. GRA comes back in and retrieves the bumper sticker. PAT gives a wink. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RV
dialogues.text: GRAHAM boards the RV. CLIVE is in the driver's seat. The engine is running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was putting the sticker on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were an odd pair, weren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely didn't speak Bocci. CLIVE fires up the engine and jams it into reverse. CRUNC

dialogues.speaker: GRAHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That wasn't their truck was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV roars off, leaving the car park and the black Linc Escalade, shiny, mean, dented.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RV
dialogues.text: GRAHAM looks at a map. CLIVE drives, continually checking rear view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. How we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be just about there. They scan the roadside for a few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV comes to a screeching halt. It sits in the road fo moment, before it trundles onto the hard shoulder. The do opens, GRAHAM and CLIVE appear wearing head mounted torch They wander over to a WHITE mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Mailbox. GRAHAM and CLIVE marvel at it. The silence of the night a the size of the landscape dawns on them. They look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing, isn't it? We're actually here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Area 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreamland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Groom Lake Military Test Facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MacArthur's Black Mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a real one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I made it up myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be great if we saw something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, imagine if we got buzzed up by a craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be incredible. It just sort of stops in the air and hovers then just goes up really fast. Whoosh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if they actually landed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it together. First contact is a big responsibility. They come in peace, we go to pieces? That's not how I roll. CLIVE looks at GRAHAM who is staring off, wide eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? GRAHAM points off into the distance. HEADLIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's them. They found us. I don't know how but they found us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Who's found us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Libyans!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run for it Marty! GRAHAM and CLIVE scramble for the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE drives, GRAHAM looks nervous. In the dashboard of t RV is a rear view monitor. They look at it intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it's not them. Perhaps whoever it was turned doff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's them. We're dead. It's like Deliverance. They're going to rape us and break our arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want my arms broken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one thing for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have to fly blind.
CLIVE kills the headlights. They are plunged into darknes still travelling at 65mph. The headlights come back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably best not to do that. I couldn't really see anything. They stare at the monitor. Suddenly, creeping up the rear the RV, headlights. The front of a car becomes visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, oh God, oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. The vehicle behind pulls out to overtake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to overtake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let them get past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I ram them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the deposit? CLIVE gingerly jerks the wheel, causing the RV to swerve. BLACK SEDAN car appears next to them, manoeuvering wildly avoid the RV. GRAHAM and CLIVE stare in horror, their eye widen as the car flips over and tumbles several times, bouncing across the asphalt and sliding to a smoking stop its roof. GRAHAM's mouth hangs open. CLIVE blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't them. The RV pulls up to the crashed vehicle and stops. GRAHAM CLIVE peer out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should see if they're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still need a wee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hold mine. GRAHAM goes to the back of the RV and into the toilet. CL remains int he driving seat, staring out at the mangled Sedan. The toilet flushes and GRAHAM reappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bulb's gone in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE step out of the RV and approach the car. Inside are three unconscious men. One door is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? They wait for a few seconds. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should call for help. GRAHAM pulls out a cell phone and starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that if I were you. GRAHAM and CLIVE spin round to see an indistinct figure sitting on a rock in the nearby darkness. The glow of a cigarette briefly lights up what appear to be two large, black eyes. GRAHAM and CLIVE gawp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rather think these men need help. Graham, give me the phone. GRAHAM passes the phone over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, I wouldn't do that. GRAHAM's mouth falls open, CLIVE continues to hold the ph to his ear. We hear the operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 911 Emergency. How may I direct your call? Hello? Hello? GRAHAM and CLIVE continue to gawp. The shape stand and st into the light. GRAHAM and CLIVE go slack. Standing in fr of them, clad only in cut-off short and flip-flops... is ALIEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put - the phone - down. Without the slightest change of expression CLIVE rocks backwards in a dead faint. He hits the ground with a bump GRAHAM looks at CLIVE then back at the ALIEN. When GRAHAM speaks his voice quivers with hysterical panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything. He fainted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes but you made him faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not. Okay I did, but it's not like i set my phaser to "Faint'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a phaser!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Look, I need you to help. Can you get this guy back onto your wagon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to probe us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Where does that come from? Why do people always assume we want to stick something up their ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. There's certainly nothing about it in the encounter manual. As a rule, we don't even abduct. Maybe people find it easier to deal with earthly transgressions if they suppress it with absurd fantasies about alien probing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a theory. Listen, focus okay? I promise you I won't hurt you, I just need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need my help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come I can understand you? Are you using some sort of neural language router?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm speaking English you prick. (off GRAHAM's expression) Sorry, I'm tense. Look, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham Willy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the writer, Clive Gollings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's get Clive into the RV and get going. I'll explain everything on the way. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV's gotta be back in 2 days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then we're gonna have to hustle, aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Graham, you're just gonna have to trust me, okay? GRAHAM looks at the ALIEN. It stands at roughly 3 feet ta His black almond shaped eye glint. His large head tilts t one side, his small mouth opens slightly, his long finger clasp together, pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please man, I need you. GRAHAM considers the ALIEN for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Now let's get Cloverfield onto the recreational vehicle and get the fuck off MacArthur's Black Mile. They attempt to move CLIVE. PAUL senses something.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh man, has he...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him he should have gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could have been worse. Know what I'm saying? They drag him into the RV. The door shuts, a few seconds later, GRAHAM appears and runs round to the back of the R He rips the bumper sticker off and gets back on board. Th starts up and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RV
dialogues.text: GRAHAM drives, agitated. He looks behind him a couple of times. PAUL is hunting around in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have this ham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! PAUL starts to dangle strips of sandwich ham into his mou wolfing it down hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul? Where am I going again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, North. Do you have a map? GRAHAM pulls the map. It obscures the wind shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when we're driving, Graham.
The map disappears back up into the roller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just head North. We need to get as much distance as we can between us and them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them? Who's them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the noise of engines, then boots on concrete as a dozen soldiers rush the area, attending the crash. A suit man gets out of a Sedan car. We don't see his face at fir The shot remains at his hip. He reaches into his pocket a pulls out a Twinkie. He unwraps it and brings it up to hi mouth. We follow and see his face for the first time. Chiselled, focused, confident. This is SPECIAL AGENT ZOIL SOLDIER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three survivors, company men, hurt but alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. ZOIL looks into the sky and breathes in the night air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? The CAPTAIN motions to a patch of moisture near his feet. ZOIL touches the wet patch and licks his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it sir? Brake fluid? Gas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's neither of those things. He looks around, then notices tire tracks in the dust by side of the road. ZOIL stands, full of purpose. He return his car and hits a button on the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a guest who's left the hotel without paying, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! Do you think he's "left' left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doubtful. NORAD would have picked up a bogie. Those guys can track Santa. No sir, he's still here. Question is, for how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think this is all a bit of a coincidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I signed the red document this morning, Zoil. Don't you think it's odd that he chooses today to go AWOL? How did he know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting he has someone on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he's definitely got someone on the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tire tracks, sir. Tire tracks... among other things. I'd bet my left nut that little bastard's hitched a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock down the area. Road blocks, spot checks, the whole nine yards. You're going to handle this personally, Zoil. I want this wrapped up before Letterman.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. RV. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Close on the wheel. Pull out to reveal the RV. Inside, CLIVE's eyes open. From the bathroom, CLIVE can h the sound of someone noisily emptying their bladder. He notices his jeans have been pegged up to dry. He leans ou see GRAHAM in the driving seat, then looks back at the bathroom door. The toilet flushes. CLIVE pretends to be asleep as the door opens. A pair of skinny grey legs in cut-off shorts pass the bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bulb's gone in there. CLIVE gets up silently and wraps his black towel around h middle. He creeps toward the front of the RV. GRAHAM driv PAUL sits in the Chewie seat eating pistachios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate it when you get the closed ones, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I usually bite them open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking insane? You gotta tap "em and if they don't open you throw them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's molluscs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Clive! How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling like I've gone MENTAL MAD, Graham. If that is your name? You're happily sitting there chatting to... to... that, like it's the most natural thing in the world. The two of you laughing away like you haven't seen each other since 1990. PAUL spits a shell out into a cup.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So forgive me if I seem a little rattled but from where I'm standing it would appear you are trading nut knowledge with an alien life form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Paul is it? Paul what? Paul Verhoven? Paul Freeman? Paul Reiser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Paul. You know, like Madonna or Dracula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's from a small planet in the northern spiral arm of the Andromeda Galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he is not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am man, seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could he possibly have travelled that distance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balls! Graham, this isn't what it seems. What about Ocham's Razor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hairdressers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the old man who owns it told me that, in unbelievable circumstances, the most plausible explanation is usually the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's the most plausible explanation, Clive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you're a thin midget in an alien costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as a thin midget? Those guys are built. Have you not seen The Station Agent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. I think that's less believable than Paul being form a planet in the norther spiral arm of the Andromeda Galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh really? With this CLIVE grabs at PAUL. He pulls at the alien's sk trying to gain a hold of a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Get off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not real. You're not real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me, you fucking psycho!

dialogues.speaker: EXCUSE ME
dialogues.text: CLIVE releases PAUL and looks out of the RV to see the flashing lights of a road block. GRAHAM slows down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! CLIVE looks round to discover that PAUL has vanished. GRA pulls the RV onto the hard shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he beamed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if. We would have seen the classic shimmer and hum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point.

dialogues.speaker: BANG, BANG, BANG
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE look to the door. Both terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE stand outside the RV being questioned by AGENT dressed like ZOIL. We can hear noise and activity f the RV. Another AGENT is aboard the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you boys from? Australia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Britain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. G'day mate. The AGENT smiles. GRAHAM and CLIVE look terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha doin' in the US fellas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comic-con.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a long way from San Diego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were having a little drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 2, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey Haggard?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? O'REILLY appears at the door waving a 10x8" photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys have met Michael Biehn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit! How was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a good egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very unaffected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Reilly? Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some pissy jeans. HAGGARD looks down at the towel wrapped around CLIVE's wa CLIVE look embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you guys can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. May I ask what you're searching for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you may. There is a slight pause. GRAHAM and CLIVE board the RV.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RV
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE pull away in silence. They are both conf and shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's pretty obvious what happened there, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the government used some sort of neurotoxic paint on the Black Mailbox, which was white by the way, and it caused us to suffer a shared hallucination about an alien. I mean, it's what we've always wanted, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Than that's what happened. PAUL materializes from thin air behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of screeching tires draws the attention of the AGENTS. They see the RV swerve across the road in the distance before righting itself and continuing on its way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you went invisible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not invisibility per so. It's more like what a chameleon does with a little light blending thrown in for good measure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Predator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do it whenever you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear GRAHAM squeal with delight. The RV guns up the ro into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE drives in silence. PAUL sits in the passenger seat eating nuts. Day is breaking over the horizon. GRAHAM sno on the sofa. PAUL offers CLIVE a nut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? How about a cup of coffee? (sees he's tempted) Come on Hulk, I'll get you a nice cuppa J. PAUL goes back to the galley, flicking GRAHAM on the nose he passes. GRAHAM wakes up with a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look who's up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Paul. GRAHAM approaches CLIVE who ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham, there is a Grey in the galley, making me coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tea's a bit weird in America, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what's wried, Graham, is that we have picked up an extra terrestrial hitch hiker and you seem completely fine with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs our help, Clive. PAUL returns with the coffee. GRAHAM and CLIVE curtail th conversation. PAUL hand CLIVE his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it? Yes I've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hot. (slightly testy) Thank you. GRAHAM looks at Paul and nods toward CLIVE. PAUL sighs an sits in the Chewie seat. GRAHAM hangs back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Clive, I'm gonna go out on a limb and say this is probably the weirdest thing that's ever happened to you. Am i right? CLIVE doesn't deny it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I appreciate the fact that I have somewhat gate-crashed the party here but, truth be told, I'm in a hell of a pickle. I really need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? CLIVE glances back at an expectant GRAHAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the RV? It has to be back in two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive, he's an alien. A living, breathing, alien. CLIVE look at PAUL who makes a sad face and does the hand gesture from Close Encounters. CLIVE wilts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose we could phone the hire company and get an extension. PAUL looks super-pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crashed in "47. Anti-grav failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happens to the best of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, I'm a shit driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Roswell?! That was you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roswell was a smoke-screen man, designed to distract from the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They invented a fake alien crash to distract from an actual alien crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, fucking stupid, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you been doing here all this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you know, kickin' back, shooting the shit. Advising the government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just the government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room lit by a single bulb, furnished with a table and chair. PAUL sits with his back to us, he is smoking a cigarette, whilst talking on the phone. We hear the voice the other end of the line. It is strangely familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I want him to have some kind of special power, you know? Something sort of messianic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about molecular revivification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restoration of damaged tissue through telepathic manipulation of cellular intrinsic field memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healing, Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right yeah. Like by touch sort of thing? His little finger could light up at the end and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Sometimes, less is more. The line beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got another call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I gotta take this man. It's the fucking V guys again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised how much he's influenced popular culture generally over the last 60 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you know so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had quite a long chat while you were unconscious. CLIVE looks miffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...while you were asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a bagel Clive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on then, I'll have half.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You want anything on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jam.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha. PAUL heads to the kitchen. The boys drive in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave your jeans a swill and hung them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. So, do you know where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just North. He said we had to make a right at Utah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't he tell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it was a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you trust him, Graham? I mean, is he Strider or Black Rider?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strider, definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better be right. I don't want to wake up and find him inserting a probe into my anus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, he doesn't do that. PAUL returns with three bagels on one long finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bagel time! The dashboard beeps. PAUL jumps throwing them into the ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuel level's critical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I had a warning light just like that on my ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For fuel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anti-grav failure. CLIVE is looking at the sat-nav on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a place called Ely five miles from here. It's small but there should be a gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that, number one.
CLIVE smiles at GRAHAM and flashes PAUL a triumphant look PAUL coughs loudly, barely disguising the word "Geeks".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE peer out at the gas station. It appears deserted. PAUL has his head in the fridge, he cracks open V8, strolls to the front of the RV and honks the horn. An MAN peers out of the gas station window and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, don't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what I need. Some organic beef mince, organic pork, some veal, red onions, pine nuts, pecorino cheese, plum tomatoes, a fistful of fresh basil and 3 war ciabattas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this is a gas station? PAUL looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the RV opens, CLIVE and GRAHAM step out onto forecourt, trying to look as casual as they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready. HOOOONNNNNKKKK! GRAHAM and CLIVE jump.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Get me some more peanut M&Ms. GRAHAM goes into the store, CLIVE to the pumps. A POLICE CRUISER pulls onto the forecourt. CLIVE goes pale and fum the nozzle back into the pump. He walks toward the checko as a STATE TROOPER exits his car. No matter how hard he tries, CLIVE cannot avoid reaching the door at the same t as the STATE TROOPER. He is tall, wide and bald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up on O'REILLY. He covers his face with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming... ready or not! O'REILLY uncovers his eyes and comes face to face with ZO ZOIL is eating an orange, he offers a segment to O'REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice and juicy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to spoil breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind telling me what's going on, Agent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keeping ourselves occupied sir. Things are pretty slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the other one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, let's see. Haggard? HAGGARD steps out from behind the only man shaped cactus the entire desert plain. O'REILLY can't help but let out snort of delighted surprise. HAGGARD hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I was just... hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. You fellas had much traffic through here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a big RV driven by a couple of nerds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nerds, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they'd been to Comic-Con and met Michael Biehn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard he's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very unaffected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you search the vehicle thoroughly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. Just Michael Biehn's autograph and some pissy jeans. Close in on ZOIL. He seems suddenly motivated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get the license plate? HAGGARD and O'REILLY look sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make? More sheepishness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want everything you can remember. Descriptions of the occupants, height, hair, distinguishing features. We can do it on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the road block sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM joins CLIVE at the check out, clutching a bag of jerky, a bottle of chocolate milk, a burrito, a Coke, som mini doughnuts and a massive bag of peanut M&Ms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think that's a bit much? Put it all back. Except the burrito... and the doughnuts... and the chocolate milk. Let's just pay for it and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need bulb for the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Essential only, Graham! They head to the counter. So does the STATE TROOPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning Chris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think I had in my office this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy Piven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The Secret Service. GRAHAM bumps into a display of sunglasses and just stops tumbling. CHRIS and the STATE TROOPER glance over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They find out how you can afford a Dodge Viper on troopers pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. They're all over this crash on the road up to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you think's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know, could be Muslims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Cheeerist! CLIVE and GRAHAM sidle up to the check-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go right ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much, officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're you guys from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Britain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Britain, huh? Nice place. No guns!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No guns? Jesus Cheeerist. CHRIS take the money and the boys leave. The STATE TROOPE and CHRIS watch them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys hurry across the forecourt past the cop car, we the radio spring to life as they pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All units, be on the lookout for a cream and brown Recreational Vehicle, no plate number at this time. Officers are advised to contain but not board. Dean, if you still at Gas and Go, bring back a quart a milk and a box of doughnut holes? Dean? GRAHAM and CLIVE stop and stare, listening intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL sit on the sofa catching M&Ms in his mouth. GRAH drives, CLIVE sits in the Chewie seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's find for you. You'll get whisked back to whatever lab they kept you in and we'll be arrested for harbouring a fugitive and sent to Guantanamo Bay. PAUL laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's everything so funny? They think we're Muslims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's their excuse for everything. There are worse things you can be. We had a Muslim guy at the base. Systems analyst called Yusef. We used to do karaoke on Tuesday nights. You should'a heard him do Matthew and Son. Shame I didn't get a chance to say salam alaikum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, the authorities know we're in an TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hardly the only RV on the road. Trust me, if we stay off the highways, keep to the back routes, we'll have a nice uneventful journey. BANG!!! Something strikes the windshield. Everyone jumps. GRAHAM bring the RV to a halt. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the RV swings open, CLIVE and GRAHAM step out The desert road is silent. We can see for miles. On the r lies a yellow and black bird, it is very dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, that made me jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah yes, the waspish markings of a Scott's Oriole. Unmistakable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing anyone could've done. PAUL looks at them, then scoops the bird up in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? PAUL closes his eyes. His skin ripples with color as he s slightly. The bird's eyes flicker, its head lifts, it ope its beak and tweets. GRAHAM and CLIVE are astounded by wh they are seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a miracle!
PAUL stuff the bird in his mouth with a grotesque crunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna eat a dead bird, am

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL and his men are parked on the forecourt of the gas station. ZOIL is talking to the STATE TROOPER and CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time I got the bulletin, they were long gone. Seemed like nice fellas to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true they was Muslims?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said they were British.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you can be both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Cheeeeerist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Zoil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me gentlemen. ZOIL leaves with the two men and returns to his vehicle. voice of ZOIL's superior cuts the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've tracked them down to a gas station in Ely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why am I not witting with my feet up, smoking a jay, watching Erin Brockovich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think he may be travelling in an RV with two British men sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, I knew we should have gone ahead with invasion in "44. What are they, MI6?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. Just a couple of nerds on the lamb from Comic-Con.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. My sister's kid went to that. Little Manga faggot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think this stinks, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like fat man doo-doo. It's too much of a coincidence. He sits tight for 60 years and then suddenly now he decides to take off. If he wanted to go home so bad, he could've just given us the slip when he was playing golf with J. Edgar Hoover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone must have told him. We need to find the rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave that to me. In the meantime, if E.T. is still M.I.A. in the P.M. then F.Y.I. I'm tearing someone a new A. O.K.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM is sat in the Chewie seat, PAUL is reading Jelva, Queen Of The Varvak. CLIVE drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me when I've finished it. CLIDE rubs his yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tired, Sausage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me Sausage in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Are you tired though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mummy, I am bushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best case, I'd like a cold flannel on my neck and an honest meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear that, Big-Rig. I can still call you Big-Rig can't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Just not Sausage. Any luck with an RV park? We need somewhere off the beaten track, n'est pas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that. Cup of Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read my mind. GRAHAM head to the galley, ignoring PAUL, who jumps into Chewie seat and stares at CLIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. I don't smoke. PAUL lights a cigarette, the smoke wafts into CLIVE's fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry okay? About eating the bird. CLIVE continues to ignore PAUL. GRAHAM arrives with the coffee and a Honey Bun cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey Bun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you unwrap it for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By your command.
GRAHAM unwraps the cake and pops it into CLIVE's gob. PAU watches. GRAHAM disappears to the back of the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something. Are you to...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... PAUL does a very weird, very long charade, demonstrating various "group' and "one on one' homosexual practices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's great. I just wondered. I'm cool with it. Everyone's "bi' where I'm from. It's all about the pleasure thing, you know? We've evolved beyond paranoid notions of gender identity. I mean, procreation is only the functional aspect of sexual congress right? The human race is fairly advanced but most males still act like a cornered tiger if you imply the like "smoking the bone' and let's face it they probably do. Look at single sex, empirical institutions, boarding schools, prisons, pirate ships, places where the choice has been removed, everyone's banging everyone else and there isn't a whiff of socio-cultural angst. Get out into the real world and guys are getting smacked int he chops for wearing pink socks. You think you're so sophisticated because you can distinguish yourself from your own reflection but ultimately you're part of a deeply neurotic species and you'd all be a lot better off if you stopped worrying and learned to love the bum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should start smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later, the RV pulls up to gate at the front of an RV park GRAHAM is now in the Chewie seat, PAUL stands behind, steadying himself on the backs of their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great find, Graham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sourced a website listing off the beaten track, North American RV parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really lucked out with you nerds, didn't I? GRAHAM and CLIVE look proud. CLIVE drives the RV over a s hump into the park. PAUL loses his balance and falls over GRAHAM and CLIVE laugh. They pull up to a gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's awfully quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the way we like it. PAUL scrambles to his feet, reaches across CLIVE and rest the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop doing that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's coming. PAUL shimmers and disappears. GRAHAM and CLIVE yelp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Graham) We're just a couple of regular guys on a tour of the less touristy side of the American midwest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? GRAHAM opens the door. RUTH BEHE, a young woman in her mi twenties stands outside. She is pretty but has no idea. S wears glasses, one eye of which is blacked out. GRAHAM st at her. We hear the slide guitar moment from Olivia Newto John's "Hopelessly Devoted To You".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, I'm Ruth Behe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Ruth. Do you mind if we come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Park in Bay 9. The charge is $50 for the night, plus $10 for hook ups an I'll need to hang onto an ID too. CLIVE disappears, leaving GRAHAM and RUTH alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just a couple of regular guys on tour of the less touristy side of the American midwest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you heading next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, east... apparently. CLIVE returns with his passport. RUTH looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: England?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Did you know it was founded by the Romans in AD 43 as Londinium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I'd love to go someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's lots a places I wanna go. Europe. Asia. The Antipodes. The world's a big place. I need one of these though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a passport? RUTH shakes her head forlornly. GRAHAM and CLIVE stare.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: RUTH! RUTH! Get in here! I'm hungry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my father. I'll come over and take your money in the morning. Have a pleasant night now, won't you? RUTH opens the gate to allow CLIVE to drive through. GRAH watches RUTH intently as they pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors to manual and cross check. Graham? Graham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm? PAUL re-materializes next to GRAHAM and CLIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUTH is walking back to a static mobile home. From the RV hear GRAHAM and CLIVE yelp. RUTH furrows her brow, turns back, and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUTH enters a static mobile home and heads for kitchenett From the ad-joining room we hear the sound of someone usi police radio scanner. Garbled reports fade in and out. We perhaps even hear ZOIL's voice briefly amid the static.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just talking.
RUTH stirs a pot on the stove. She surreptitiously retrie an atlas from a drawer an starts to read.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You talk to much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Papa.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: How long they staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the night I think

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hook ups?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Where they headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Them California plates I saw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but they're from London.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: London, Ohio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, London, England.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Where?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: England, Papa. It's in North Western Europe. The atlas is snatched out of RUTH's hands. Behind her sta the towering figure of MOSES BEHE. Almost as wide as he i tall, his eyes glitter with fury and menace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Europe? I'll give you Europe, missy. Now, get and make my supper. MOSES lumbers off with the atlas. RUTH looks dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS as GRAHAM and CLIVE hook up power and water to RV and prepare a small BBQ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the RV opens, GRAHAM and CLIVE jump in. PAUL lowers his book and is blinded by their headlamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrghh, what the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ate already. GRAHAM and CLIVE look suddenly sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too soon? They nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm sorry. I'd love to break bread with you guys. What are we having? GRAHAM waves a foot long hot dog around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willies! PAUL gives CLIVE a "see what I mean?' look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll flame up the BBQ pit. Fire's my forte. CLIVE sparks up his lighter and waves it around looking mysterious. He then turns and jumps down all three steps slams the door of the RV behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE is squirting lighter fluid over a fire. He flicks h tongue out, summoning the flames higher. PAUL materialize nearby, making CLIVE jump. He composes himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Clive. From the squirting of the gas and the flicking of the tongue, am I do assume you're a Hendrix fan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am actually, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met him once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Nice man, really soft, He thought I was a hallucination. Shame what happened to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the good ones die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile Bryan Adams releases album seventeen. PAUL and CLIVE share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've been here for 60 years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, right? Time flies when you're confined to a U.S. military installation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come to earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the vanguard of a highly aggressive invading force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fucking with you, man. I was on a science mission actually. Meteorological reconnaissance. We were surveying atmospheric conditions on CO2 spiking, M-Class planets. My specialist subject is tornadoes right? So I'm buzzing around the mid-west, looking for twisters and all of a sudden my A.G.G. goes offline and I crash in the middle of some field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next thing I know, this little girl is pulling me out of the wreck and then a bunch of army guys come along and cart me off to Area 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's 52. Area 51 is just full of old Pan Am jets and mini disc players and shit. It's another "clever subterfuge." GRAHAM joins them with the food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just telling him about Area 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, with my cover blown and the natives cautious but friendly, I figured we might as well indulge in a little file sharing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder was right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder was my idea. They chuckle. CLIVE gives PAUL the bottle of gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a go? PAUL takes the bottle and squirts it on the fire, making Hendrix face. They laugh loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUTH watches through her window. GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL a on the other side of the RV. Nevertheless, RUTH can see t pairs of dancing legs underneath the vehicle, silhouetted against the campfire. She frowns.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: RUTH backs away into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very early in the morning. PAUL is asleep on the so There is a knock at the door. PAUL vanishes. GRAHAM and C emerge from the bedroom in dressing gowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's Ruth. GRAHAM and CLIVE look at each other nervously. CLIVE open the door, as GRAHAM straightens his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CLIVE give GRAHAM a "what the hell are you thinking?' Lo RUTH comes aboard. RUTH surveys the interior of the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was everything to your liking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the other one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, we don't charge by the person. That was three pairs of legs I saw last night cavorting round the camp fire, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh the other one. Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the can. I ate a closed mollusc. PAUL blows a massive raspberry to prove his point. GRAHAM CLIVE look embarrassed. GRAHAM changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your shirt. The shirt has a picture of Jesus shooting Charles Darwin the head. Underneath it reads, "Evolve this!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I got it at my church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would Jesus want to shoot Charles Darwin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of his theories. Are you men of God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose we're men of science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUTH narrow her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we believe in anything it would be macro evolution. Cause and effect. The establishment of a biological order from the maelstrom of physical and chemical chaos. RUTH looks scandalized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or it could be God. You just don't know do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God created the earth in six days and on the seventh he rested. PAUL emits another huge raspberry from the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that the universe has been dated as being 13.5 billion years old an that the release of neutral hydrogen at the moment of the big bang has enabled scientists to do this with categorical accuracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world is 4000 years old.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh come on!

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Horseshit! RUTH approaches the toilet door, taking up her fight with unseen third passenger. She bangs on the door. GRAHAM and CLIVE are bewildered by this sudden turn of events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain to me how something as complicated as the human eye simply comes into being.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, don't give me that old irreducible complexity crap-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eye is comprised of three interacting parts. Remove any one of them and it ceases to exist. It has the precision and delicacy of a pocket watch and, when the good Lord permits, it works in perfect harmony with its environment. Something as functionally perfect as that doesn't just occur without the intervention of a guiding hand.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: But it didn't just occur did it? It is the culmination of millions of years of development across countless species.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Evolution baby. RUTH screams and bangs the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd design!

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
