dialogues.text: If He designed it, why didn't He just make it one part and take the whole weekend off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you can so or do can shake my belief, or faith in the sure and certain knowledge that God made Heaven and earth and created us all in His own image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? (stepping out of the toilet) Well then how do you explain me? RUTH's mouth hangs agape in a soundless scream, her eye r up, her hair turns white. She collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's Jenga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything, she fainted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She saw you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on. Who's gonna believe anything she says?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The authorities will be on the look out for exactly this sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, a delusional, one-eyed God botherer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, right now they're going to follow any lead they can get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could take her with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're only going to be a couple of days. We could let her go once Paul's gone home. I'm sure she'll be fine once she gets to know us. PAUL and CLIVE consider this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I going to get my passport back? PAUL vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Leave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, seemingly by itself. PAUL materializes in kitchenette and starts looking around for CLIVE's passpor He roots around noisily in drawers and cupboards, until h spies his quarry on the work-top. He checks the passport finds CLIVE's absurd picture. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallelujah.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ruth, what in the Lord's name- MOSES and PAUL come face to face. They regard each other a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL burst out of the BEHE RESIDENCE, pursued by MOSES wh loading a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: The RV start to move forward. The door swings open and GR appears, beckoning to PAUL. PAUL reaches the door, just a MOSES levels the gun at his target. PAUL leaps into GRAHA arms, disappearing inside the RV, as MOSES fires off a booming shot. The BEHE mailbox explodes into pieces, as t RV careens off out of the trailer park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackness. RUTH wakes up. Panic in her eyes. CLIVE drives GRAHAM sits on the sofa, biting his nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I? PAUL leans round from the Chewie seat and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look who's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a cup of tea? RUTH starts to pray furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry it had to be this way Ruth. We're definitely not going to hurt you and we'll let you go as son as we can. We were just a little concerned that you might call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been deceived. Deceived by an agent of Satan himself.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You know I'm sitting right here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a demon Ruth, he's from another world and we're helping him get home. He's not evil. He's just very rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can he be from another world? There is only one world. Our world, created by God the Father. PAUL sits down next to GRAHAM. RUTH whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if it makes you feel any better, my existence only disproves the notion of the Abrahamic, Judeo- Christian God, as well as all single earth theologies. Science still hasn't categorically rule out the notion of divinity, even though evolutionary biology suggest the non-existence of a creator by probability alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could that possibly make me feel any better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, I was just trying to be nice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think what Paul's trying to say is, just because there are other inhabited planets, it's not the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't happening! You're a hallucination. You're not real. You're a test. A test from God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't win can you? RUTH starts to pray furiously, speaking in tongues, makin awful noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't drive like this. We'll have to drop her off and take our chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for God's sake. PAUL walks over to RUTH and places his and across her forehead. He appear to go into a trance. RUTH's eyes roll into her head. We see a lightening montage of images. The cosmos, the surface of a planet, others like PAUL, PAUL's ship crashing into the ground. The images speed up as PAU telepathically send his knowledge into RUTH's mind. They collapse in a heap on the floor. PAUL sparks up a cigaret

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to her?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broadened her horizons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you broaden mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's tiring. GRAHAM goes over to where PAUL is lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here then. PAUL puts his hand on GRAHAM's head. GRAHAM's eyes go all fluttery. We don't see the images this time. GRAHAM falls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great! Everyone knows the secrets of the universe apart from me. He always knew what was going on in Buffy before me because his mum had cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't I just tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No spoilers! PAUL sighs, then with enormous effort, reaches up and zap CLIVE who falls to the floor. Everyone lays inert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should make that tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE BLACK SEDANS are parked in the BEHE RV park.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I didn't call the government. I called the po-lice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Given your description of the intruder, the police felt your call was perhaps better directed to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret Service, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. You know that devil took my Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Ruth's your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Her Mama died when she was born. I good as brought her up by myself. Wasn't easy either. Two mouths to feed and this place to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. Do you have a photography of Ruth, Mr. Behe? MOSES retrieves an old cigar box and produces a tattered photograph of Ruth. She appears younger, with both eyes intact and with dark hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty. MOSES snorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a phone Mr. Behe? In case she tries to contact you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do... ZOIL nods at HAGGARD who immediately starts dialling on h satellite phone, moving into a different room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and she'll call me if she can. Ruth's never really been outta Carbon County.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say they went East?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. They'll have to get off the 191 after Flaming Gorge if they ain't using the interstate, there's been a rig spill just South of Dutch John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that means they'll be on the 44. Only way to go. ZOIL looks at O'REILLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Haggard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you're gonna kill that thing, Mr. Zoil. Kill it for what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do our best, Mr. Behe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch yourself now. I seen its eyes. It's evil. ZOIL, HAGGARD and O'REILLY leave. MOSES watches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God's speed, Mr. Zoil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL's radio crackles to life.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Man, that way was one fat freak!

dialogues.speaker: O'REILLY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: If I was that girl, I think I'd rather take my chances with the alien. HAGGARD and O'REILLY hoot with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can it, you two! How many times do I have to tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSES is sat at his kitchen table listening to his police scanner. HAGGARD and O'REILLY's laughter rattles loudly o the radio.

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We do not refer to the target as "The Alien'. MOSES's expression is mixture of fury and disbelief. He glances at something nearby. Pull focus to the shotgun, l in the foreground on the kitchen table. We hear an engine splutter into life, revving furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSES in his pick up truck, screams off in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on PAUL. He is staring at something in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Pull out to reveal him sitting next to GRAHAM and CLIVE, looking out through the RV's windshield. We see their POV. A breathtaking panorama of natural beau They are parked up at the summit of a mountain road, look out across the vista.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is, boys. Wyoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. I gotta tell ya. It's at times like these you winder if the intelligent design crowd aren't onto something. I mean look at it. Hey Ruth, get up here. They look round, the door of the RV is open, RUTH is gone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone should go after her. Graham? CLIVE looks round to see GRAHAM gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUTH is storming up the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth, please stop, I've got shin splints. RUTH stops. GRAHAM catches up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't be from space. It's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth, you saw for yourself. It's not just possible, it's probably. There's probably millions of intelligent civilizations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, one of them is right there. RUTH and GRAHAM look back at the RV. PAUL is stood on the dashboard with his bare buttocks pressed against the wind CLIVE is trying not to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I've ever been told is a lie. My purpose. My truth. All false. DO you know how that feels? To suddenly have nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because your truth wasn't the truth, it doesn't mean there is no truth, Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you're probably feeling very confused right now. Religious belief systems are devised to give us context and security. To stop us feeling lonely and unimportant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do feel lonely and unimportant! How can this all be an accident? It doesn't make sense. Did you know the reason we have solar eclipses is because the sun is exactly 400 times bigger than the moon and the moon is exactly 400 times closer to the earth? GRAHAM considers saying "yes' but decides against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can that be an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't, it's a coincidence. Or it probably is. That's the beauty of the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what's the point? If there's nothing afterwards, what's the point in living?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the point, Ruth. Right now. This conversation. That tree, your next cheeseburger. Life is a miracle. People spend so much time focusing on rescuing the princess, they forget how much fun it is to fight the dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Sagan said "A religion, old or new, that stressed the magnificence of the universe as revealed by modern science might be able to draw forth reserves of reverence and awe hardly tapped by the conventional faiths.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay not to know, Ruth. It's wonderful because it means we still have things to learn. We still have life to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I, but it passes, sort of. Ruth, we're on an amazing adventure and I think you should come with us. I know you feel confused and lost but if you get back on board that RV, you might just find the very thing you're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure Ruth. I'm sure because I can honestly say, I have never talked to a woman for this long without blushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so sweet. GRAHAM blushes, deep, dark, red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and RUTH get back onto the RV. GRAHAM looks please with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to be fine. I think your hair looks good by the way. You look like Storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Storm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From X-Men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. RUTH goes to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. RV
dialogues.text: The RV drives across the rugged countryside. GRAHAM, CLIV RUTH and PAUL appear in various combinations. GRAHAM drives with PAUL in the Chewie seat, CLIVE sleeps the sofa, RUTH can be seen sitting on the bed at the back CLIVE drives with GRAHAM in the Chewie seat. PAUL just behind, RUTH on the sofa. She is staring at PAUL. PAUL tu round, she looks away. PAUL drives, CLIVE sits in the Chewie seat, GRAHAM and RU just behind. The RV weaves from side to side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small corrections! Small corrections! RUTH drives. Everyone else is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. ZOIL'S CAR/HAGGARD'S CAR/O'REILLY'S CAR
dialogues.text: We see ZOIL's convoy. ZOIL drives, his eyes intent on the road, searching. He reaches down out of shot, then brings taco to hi mouth and takes a bit. A truck passes. We see HAGGARD in his car, talking animatedly on his cell phone. truck passes. We see O'REILLY in his car, he is asleep at wheel. The truck passes, horn blaring. O'REILLY wakes up suddenly, looking rattled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV is parked up. It is a little speck on an enormous landscape. Next to the highway is a sign which reads "YO NOW LEAVING UTAH.' Underneath this a separate sign reads
leaps back and forth over the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 o'clock, 12 o'clock, 11 o'clock, 12 o'clock, 11 o'clock. Come on! It's fun. We see CLIVE, GRAHAM and RUTH standing in the middle of t road watching PAUL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the furthest I've ever been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL's convoy pulls into an Arby's. The three AGENTS leap of their cars and run in. After a short pause MOSES BEHE' pick up truck passes through shout; "Onward Christian Soldiers' blares from the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM drives, CLIVE sits in the Chewie seat. PAUL hangs back. RUTH emerges from the bedroom. She has swapped her Darwin T-shirt for one of GRAHAM's. It's an X-files T-shi emblazoned with a UFO and the legend, I WANT TO BELIEVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind, do you, Graham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we should stop for something to eat. Are you hungry, Ruth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's new, fatty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's not fat, it's power. I happen to be very strong. PAUL summons a phlegm ball with a grotesque snort and spi it onto the floor of the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick that up then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So childish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should call Papa.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL/GRAHAM/CLIVE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've been missing for a whole day. If he's called the police, they'll be looking for us and if they find us, this "amazing adventure' is going to come to an end real quick. I just need to tell him I'm fine and that I'll be back soon, okay? PAUL offers up a high five to RUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right up top! RUTH yelps, terrified that PAUL is going to zap her again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too soon? CLIVE reaches down and picks up PAUL's phlegm ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM, CLIVE and RUTH step out of the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, in and out, yes? Don't talk to anyone unless you have to and try to look inconspicuous. Angle on the most conspicuous threesome in America. HOOOOOOOONNNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish he'd stop doing that! They enter the bar. Parked nearby, is a black Lincoln Escalade, shiny, mean, dented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar is very busy. Scantily clad waitresses serve a variety of customers. People play pool, other people danc a small band. RUTH spies a pay phone at the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll order food and wait for you at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. RUTH walks through to the back, past the toilets. As she passes, MOSES BEHE steps out of the Men's, they miss each other by moments. He walks up to the bar, next to GRAHAM CLIVE who are looking at a menu. MOSES orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tap water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUTH dials. She listens nervously. Click.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ruth Behe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Please hold, your call is being diverted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I...

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ruth Behe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Agent Zoil, Secret Service. Listen very carefully. You're in great danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you...?

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We know who you're travelling with Ruth. I need you and your friend to turn yourselves in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we don't want to turn ourselves in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL talks on a satellite phone. HAGGARD works on a lapto nearby. O'REILLY listens in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you? Where are you headed?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you think you're doing the right thing but I promise you, I'm only thinking about you. And Paul. You care about Paul, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't know how I feel about him. He's weird and also, rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he is.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I asked him why he wore shorts and he said if he didn't I'd see his big spaceman balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud giggles, followed by angry shushing from ZOIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there with you?

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ruth, please listen to me. Your father is worried about you. We want to get you home. I need you to tell me where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He showed me things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not still talking about his balls, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... i just want to know what's real. I'm confused. I... I... RUTH struggles. Her expression shows great conflict.

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Damnit, Haggard! RUTH panics and slams down the phone. She realizes what s may have done and rushes back toward the bar, slamming in two men. The MEATHEADS, drunk, look down at her, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, slow down there cyclops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get to my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hurry? You know I got a friend with one eye who'd love to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I happen to have two eyes actually. I just have a severe stigmatism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should get that fixed up. Reckon you'd be kinda pretty in the right light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa said the Lord would fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord ain't gonna fix nothing sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. RUTH plants her knee firmly into the groin of GUS. He dou up knocking his friend over. RUTH bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE are clutching brown paper bags full of f RUTH returns from the Phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to leave now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still waiting on a wet fries. The two MEATHEADS emerge from the pay phone. Angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! It's the space faggots that dinged the fuck-mobile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm terribly sorry. Perhaps we can exchange insurance details?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I don't speak "nerd'. GRAHAM and CLIVE look terribly offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These the "friends' you told us about, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well whaddya know? Small world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.
JAKE grabs RUTH. GRAHAM pushes him hard in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (timid but resolute) He said, leave her alone. At this, JAKE pulls his fist back to hit CLIVE, knocking tray of drinks all over a table full of men. They immedia spring up and lunge after the MEATHEADS who turn their attention to the attack. The fight spreads like fire. GRA grabs RUTH's hand and follows CLIVE as he scrambles throu the fracas. As they reach the door RUTH is yanked back an comes face to face with her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk back to me, girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chair smashes across MOSES's head, knocking him out. Be him, bloodied and angry are the two MEATHEADS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE, GRAHAM and RUTH explode out of the bar and run tow the RV. The MEATHEADS crash out after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Papa?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we ain't finished with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham, take Ruth into the RV and lock the door. I don't want either of you to see this. CLIVE turns back to the MEATHEADS. BANG! CLIVE is struck the face, he falls, nose bleeding. They turn to RUTH and GRAHAM, who back up against the RV. MEATHEADS approach ominously. The RV door bursts open. PA stands silhouetted against the interior lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo fucknuts! The MEATHEADS freeze. PAUL vanishes, then reappears a few feet from them, their eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, who wants to get probed first? The MEATHEADS swoon and simultaneously hit the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Only one of us fainted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you got the food? CLIVE gets up and opens his coat revealing bags of food. Sirens wail in distance. RUTH turns white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't my fault. They answered the phone. He knew all about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Who are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the RV! SMASH CUT. The RV roars to life, backing up at speed into MEATHEAD's vehicle. MOSES BEHE bursts out of the bar, jus the RV passes. RUTH sees him out of the window. MOSES loc eye with his daughter. He runs to his pick up but realise doesn't have his keys. The RV tears off into the night, leaving MOSES BEHE bellowing with anger and the Lincoln Escalade, shiny, mean, fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV pulls off the road into a secluded lay-by. The gan sit in silence for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that your dad, Ruth? RUTH nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was so angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's always angry. GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL all exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright, Ruth? RUTH nods, still distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling pretty amped up. Anyone wanna take a walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come for a walk, Ruth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I think I'm going to turn in. It's been a long day what with meeting you guys, being abducted by and alien and having my whole belief system called into question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was amazing though, wasn't it? Remember when Paul said "Yo fucknuts'? That was brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta talk the talk, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about when I got smacked in the nose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah Snorlax, you're a real hero. Come on. Let's skedaddle. You want anything Ruth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you go, I'll be fine. Here Clive. RUTH hands CLIVE her handkerchief. It is embroidered with words "JESUS SAVES'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He mops his nose as they leave the RV. GRAHAM lingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can sleep in my bunk if you'd like. She smiles at him. He goes to leave but turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd use a pen to push the tissues off the bed. I've had a cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and PAUL stand outside a liquor store on the main of a quiet town. Next door is a Western themed clothing store. PAUL looks in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Graham. Check this out. What d'ya think? PAUL indicates to a small cowboy outfit, big enough for a child, displayed in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd look pretty hot, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve Miller Band. I love that song. Speaking of midnight tokers, I got a littler herbal refreshment in my pants. Do you guys partake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame. I get it from the military. This is the shit that killed Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Dylan's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he? CLIVE comes out of the liquor store clutching bags of bee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's party!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL have made a camp fire in a woodlan clearing on the other side of town. They sit round drinki beers and chatting. PAUL rolls a joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why "Paul'? It's not very, you know, alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it spelt like, P-'-a-w-l-l or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P-o-o-u-r-l?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's Paul. Like Paul Newman or the little guy from Simon and Garfunkel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Simon. Paul's not my real name. It's a name I got given.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your real name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't be able to pronounce it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can speak Klingon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a geek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, what's your real name. PAUL opens his mouth and screeches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roooooootttchaaaaaaaaaaa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roooooootttttttccchhaaaa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rootchaa? That sounds like Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Rog. More laughter. Even PAUL. He lights his joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like a poster on a student's wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my gag! "Take me to your dealer' right? Yeah, that was mine. Never saw a dime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never answered my question. Why Paul? Who called you Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl who found me when I crashed. It was terrible actually. I killed her dog. I didn't mean to! My ship sort of landed on it. When the military arrived I was delirious; I kept saying "Paul? Paul?" It was the only English I knew, because I'd heard the little girl saying it over and over. Spooks thought it was my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She called her dog Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least it wasn't Mr. Muggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the little girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? Never saw her again. Think about her everyday though. PAUL offers the joint round. CLIVE and GRAHAM decline. PA takes a deep drag. During the following exchange, GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL start to move simultaneously as though governed by some kind of psychic link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's strange, isn't it? Ordinarily in this situation Graham and I would be looking up at the stars, wondering about life on other planets but we know now, don't we? It's a bit of an anti-climax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a bunch, Hurley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean that in a bad way. They all scratch their noses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you in such a hurry to leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've outlived my usefulness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only so much knowledge I can share about the universe and quantum theory and how to make a really nice meatball sandwich. The only thing I have to offer them now are my abilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the only way they're going to get hold of them is by obtaining some of somatic stem cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, do they take a swab from your cheek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadly, not that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood?! Oh my god, I hate needles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, a needle would be a picnic compared to what they had in store for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stem cells are multipotent. GRAHAM and CLIVE look blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lineage defined? GRAHAM and CLIVE still look blank.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The camouflage response, the memory transfer, the revivification, they all originate in my cerebellum. In order to cultivate them in a laboratory they would have to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut your brain out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo! Fortunately, someone was kind enough to give me the heads up, if you'll pardon the pun. So, when they were transferring me to the medical facility and I noticed the bumper sticker on your RV, I figured you might be sympathetic types. I zapped the spooks, grabbed the wheel and took my chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the crash was our fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it was, kinda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're saying if they catch you... PAUL draws his thumb across his neck. GRAHAM and CLIVE lo at PAUL in horror. All three scratch their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me, are you guys virgins or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They all cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then, Clive, when was the last time you got laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comic-Con 2005. Ewok chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years ago you had sex with a midget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was an Ewok! Sniff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are only two types of person small enough to fit inside an Ewok costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a midget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you thought boning a space bear sounded less embarrassing than a person of short stature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sly dog! PAUL rolls onto his back, clapping. GRAHAM snorts into hi beer, laughing. CLIVE joins in. Before long, the three friends are rolling around in hysterics, utterly out of control. After about thirty seconds of this, they pass ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has just risen. GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL lie round smoldering camp fire sleeping soundly. PAUL is very white His eyes open. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Hey, wake up. Wake up. We fell asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I get this thing when I get high. It's called "projective empathy'. You feel what I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like in E.T.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank God. For a second there I thought I'd got drunk on Lite beer. The guys gather their stuff and walk to the edge of the w Looking through the tree line they realize that the quiet town of last night has become very busy indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't walk through there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we going to get back? Close in on GRAHAM having the best idea of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE walk down the busy main street, between is PAUL. He is dressed in the little cowboy suit from the shop window, his hat pulled down low over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should hold hands, so that we look like a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great! Two grown men who look like sex offenders holding hands with a child cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could be a midget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're obsessed with midgets! They continue on, trying to look as if nothing is strange

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seem to be working, Clive. Clive? GRAHAM notices that CLIVE is no longer with them. He look back to see CLIVE, gawping thought the window of a COMIC SHOP, at a sword resembling the one they saw at Comic-Con The tag reads "Genuine "BLADE' Katana'. $299.99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive, no. CLIVE walks into the shop. GRAHAM and PAUL follow quickly behind. As they enter the COMIC SHOP, MOSES BEHE emerges the adjacent Drug Store. He takes a couple of pain killer and flexes his sore shoulders. He wanders up the road, scanning the passers by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM approaches CLIVE who is at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's not really the time, Sausage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very cheap. Are you sure you don't want to save up and get a proper on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, we've got time.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RV
dialogues.text: Close on RUTH's watch. She paces, worried. KNOCK KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been? I was worried. She opens the door. AGENT ZOIL flashes his badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Ma'am. Sorry to trouble you. Agent Zoil, Secret Service. Your wagon here matches the description of a recreational vehicle we're currently looking for. May I ask, are you alone? RUTH pauses a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind taking a look at these pictures? ZOIL pulls out three pictures and hands them to RUTH. CCT shots of GRAHAM and CLIVE at the gas station and MOSES's of RUTH, looking younger, with dark hair and no glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you recognise any of these people, Miss? She lingers on the picture of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sorry I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you coming from, Ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christian ministry in Seattle. I've been driving for 5 days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. It has an impressive bat population you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks gather by the rive in the evening to watch them fly out. Turn the sky black. Quite a sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Well, I really should be getting along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Thanks for your time, Miss...? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darwin, Charlotte Darwin. ZOIL smiles and nods. He laves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM and CLIVE are at the counter. CLIVE is trying out blade. PAUL, in cowboy guise browses the racks of comics. picks one up. The cover features an alien that looks a lo like him. The comic is called "Encounter Briefs: Tales F the Dreamland'. PAUL smiles and shakes his head. He sudde realises he is being watched. Next to him is a child, (8) small enough to see under PAUL's hat. He is looking at th cover of the comic and back at PAUL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose it does. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith Nash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Paul. Pleased to meet you. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You on your own here, Keith Nash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Mom's shopping for some new jeans. She lets me wait in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a good Mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes and no. What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend's buying a sword. He's a grown man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a nerd. PAUL laughs. So does KEITH NASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You an M&Ms man, Keith? PAUL produces his M&Ms. He offers one to KEITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am but I shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strangers with candy, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've got a lot in common. We both like comics and M&Ms. Guess that makes us pals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess so. KEITH beams at PAUL and takes a few M&Ms. They turn t attention back to the racks of comics. PAUL pulls one out called "G-Men'. On the cover it shows an agent, not unli ZOIL, shooting an alien not unlike PAUL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good one. Take it. Go on. It's a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Paul.
KEITH stuffs it down his trousers. PAUL laughs. We hear M NASH calling from the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch you later, Keith Nash. GRAHAM and CLIVE approach. CLIVE has a long sword shaped under his arm and a big grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith Nash. How much was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $299.99. It's made of a low grade Turkish alloy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you get, speccy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X-Men action figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Cheeeerist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL exit the comic shop. PAUL waves to KEITH NASH, who now sits outside, on a bench, with his MOTHER. The boys walk up the street, seconds later, HAGGA and O'REILLY step out of a store, eating bags of candy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NASH
dialogues.text: Don't lie, Keith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not lying.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NASH
dialogues.text: Oh, come on now, Keith. If you carry on like this, you'll have to come with me to Dress Barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly Mommy, he was an alien and his name was Paul!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NASH
dialogues.text: Whoever hard of an alien called Paul?
HAGGARD is suddenly kneeling at KEITH NASH's side. O'REIL stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say, kid?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NASH
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Haggard Ma'am, Secret Service.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NASH
dialogues.text: Secret Service?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he still in there? KEITH shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say where he was going? KEITH looks at his comic. The ZOIL style agent, shooting PAUL style alien. He looks back at HAGGARD and points him the entirely wrong direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South. Toward New Mexico, huh? KEITH nods. HAGGARD stands, his mind racing. He looks meaningfully at O'REILLY not noticing the RV rumbling up street behind him with CLIVE at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got him man! We're going to get a fucking promotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good kid. Want a candy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. The two agents rush off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Zoil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw Zoil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSES BEHE kicks at the remains of the campfire. He bends down and picks something up. It is Ruth's handkerchief, n stained with dirt and blood. He screws it into his shakin hand. An engine roars. He looks up to see the RV rumbling the road. It turns onto the Eastbound Highway. MOSES' pic is parked about 200 yards away. MOSES starts to lumber towards it as fast as he can, which isn't very fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAGGARD and O'REILLY sprint up to their vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Where the hell do you think you're going? HAGGARD can't hide his frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We picked up a lead, sir. Little kid in the town said he saw an alien. Said he was heading toward New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were just gonna take off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought it best to take the initiative, sir. We were going to radio you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now, that's mighty civil of you. We have a chain of command. I expect you to abide by it. Where d'you say he was headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Mexico sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then let's move it. They scramble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and Haggard? Don't go getting ideas about your station again. ZOIL gets into his car leaving HAGGARD looking pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSES drives, Ruth's bloody handkerchief gripped between hands and the wheel. He listens to his police scanner.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Zoil, what the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: They've double back sir. They're heading toward New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You better be right about this, Zoil. I'm getting a little tired of this shit. I want that little fucker's brain in a jar by sundown. MOSES smiles darkly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you're going the wrong way, Agent Zoil. That's what happens when you don't got the Lord on your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSES BEHE's pick up roars through shot, revealing a larg roadside sign proclaiming LUCIFER'S CUT PRICE FIREWORK WAREHOUSE. Creep in on the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV is parked outside the firework warehouse. RUTH and PAUL sit opposite each other at the dining table. RUTH is holding the X-Men action figure, Storm. PAUL watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes you, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham? D'you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, blind? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got there, a stigmatism?
RUTH nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you can get on operation for that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa said the Lord would fix it. Guess that's not gonna happen, seeing as we're living in a gigantic godless universe, with no hope of salvation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't know categorically that it's godless. I just said "probably'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's a relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the way you're feeling now, that's why religion appeared in the first place. It's like existential Prozac. Imagine being five year sold and having no adults around to tell you why it snows or what trees are for. That's how it is for much of humanity. Faith is a night- light. It illuminates the scary corners, fills the gaps, makes the universe easier to comprehend. Thing is, it's okay not to know everything. I mean, who knows what's really out there? Did you know astrophysicists recently identified the equation for the creation of matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, then you get it, right? If they have the theory, who's to say at some point in the future they won't put it into practice and who's to say someone else didn't do that 13.5 Billion years ago and that's how the universe came to be? Course, then we get the eternal problem of who created the creator but that's a whole other car park. I think Shakespeare said it best. "There's more in Heaven and earth than is dreamt of in your philosophy Horatio".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horatio. It's from Hamlet. You know, the Prince of Denmark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denmark has a municipal population of 508,691. PAUL blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, if there is a God, didn't he create doctors and hospitals and scalpels and shit, so he wouldn't have to go round fixing people's lazy eyeballs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eye is a delicate and complex thing, Ruth. You should get it taken care of. RUTH smiles. PAUL smiles back. RUTH looks out of the wind just as PAUL reaches out to touch her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back. PAUL withdraws his hand. GRAHAM and CLIVE are approaching RV clutching a large firework. They climb aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone home.

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL
dialogues.text: ZOIL jumps but gathers his composure quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satellite's come up with a data analysis on all the traffic coming out of Prospect in the last 5 hours. There was only one RV, and guess what, nimrod?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't going to New Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a three pointer Agent Zoil. You better spin your ass around. You got some serious catching up to do. Don't make me come out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. Where are they headed? If we gun it, maybe we can get the drop on their destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on the 50, heading towards Gillette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else is around there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much. Thunder Basis, Bethlehem Creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bethlehem Creek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL's motorcade pulls a spectacular U-turn and heads bac the highway in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSES listens intently to his scanner.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You don't think she's sill there, do you? MOSES smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSES BEHE's pick-up truck pulls a similarly spectacular and heads in a different direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caption: Bethlehem Creek, Wyoming GRAHAM, CLIVE, RUTH and PAUL stare through the window of RV at the farmhouse glimpsed in the first scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think she's still there do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you're going to find out for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't just knock can I? What if she's moved on and someone else answers? I'm sick of people fainting on me. I'll hang back with my buddy Ruth, you two make first contact. Just enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shall we say if it's her? We're here with the alien that killed your dog sixty years ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Hurry up, there's going to be a really big storm in exactly 34 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock again.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara Walton?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. GRAHAM goes to leave. CLIVE stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Walton, I'm the writer, Clive Gollings and this is my friend and colleague, Graham Willy. We're from England and we're here with the alien that killed your dog 60 years ago. Silence. The sound of multiple locks. The door opens to reveal a woman (68). Grey, dishevelled but with fire in h eyes. She scowls at GRAHAM and CLIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, some kind of joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no joke. PAUL materializes between GRAHAM and CLIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Tara. TARA's faces sickens. She falls backwards into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAHAM, CLIVE, RUTH and PAUL all sit on a sofa. TARA sits opposite, staring at PAUL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should make some tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my manners? I never really have guests. Nobody comes up here. I go whole weeks without seeing a soul.
TARA goes to the kitchen. She can be seen from where they sitting. She turns the gas on and strikes a cooking match PAUL looks pained, struggling for something to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I do anything to help? TARA stand in the kitchen doorway, the lit match in her h PAUL stands and walks toward her, she watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've only just stopped believing in you, y'know? Spent a very long time trying to convince folk about what happened that night. My parents, my friends. Everyone thought I was mad. They told me it was a meteor that squashed little Paul. Took me away and did tests they did, said it was for cosmic radiation. They said I was concussed, hallucinating, but I knew you were real. I pulled you from that spaceship myself. Sat with you till the men came and took you away. If Pop hadn't had to go to Casper, he would have seen you too. They kept telling me I'd imagined it but I knew different. Pop tried to understand but they filled his head with "delayed this' and "post- traumatic that'. He just used to smile and say "there, there Tara'. He got sick when I was seventeen and died a few years later. I inherited this place. Word got out about my story not long after it happened, so I didn't really have any friends. Kids used to throw stones at the house and call me names. I just kinda retreated into myself. I'd spend whole nights up on the roof, staring at the sky, hoping to catch a glimpse of you again. I always believed that one day you"d come back and here you are. The match flame reaches her fingers, she shakes it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me gabbing. Milk and sugar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For killing your dog and ruining your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter. Don't you see? You're real. I was right and all those folk that said I was crazy? Well, they can all go fuck themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you, Tara. The tinkle of glass. Something hits the floor. A tear gas canister spins at their feet, spewing thick fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, where do you suppose that came from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck a duck! Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara, where's the back door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In back. The gang bustle out of the room just as the front door splinters inward, revealing O'REILLY in a gas mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang quickly barricade the door of the next room and continue on toward the back of the house. They find the b door, just as it is opened by ZOIL. The gang freeze. PAUL vanishes, then reappears right next to ZOIL, putting his across ZOIL's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, wait- A burst of psychic images explode into ZOIL's head. The a and the alien fall on the ground in an exhausted heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little help?
CLIVE picks PAUL up. HAGGARD approaches, gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze, space monkey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're cut off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm cellar! TARA opens a nearby door and motions them down some stair as HAGGARD fires wildly. Crockery explodes around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godammit Haggard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang descend into a dim room. It is full of UFO paraphernalia. Models, toys, books, souvenirs from every hot spot in the land. One the wall is the "Take Me To Yo Dealer' poster. PAUL sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a fucking cent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL comes to. He sees HAGGARD at the cellar door. Screec brakes draw his attention as MOSES BEHE's truck skids up. gets out, shotgun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEAM PAUL climb out of the cellar and start to run toward the RV, PAUL still in CLIVE's arms. It starts to rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, my shins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL sees MOSES run round to the front of the farmhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'REILLY sees TEAM PAUL running toward the RV from the fr room. He levels his pistol at PAUL and squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEAM PAUL reach the RV and start to board, just as MOSES lumbers into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa? PAUL grabs RUTH's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (levelling his shotgun) Take your hands off her, devil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'REILLY find his mark. Pull back to reveal he is stood b the kitchen door, through which we see the cooker, the si of gas in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready or not. He fires.

dialogues.speaker: KA-BOOM
dialogues.text: O'REILLY is vaporized in a ball of orange fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The farmhouse explodes. ZOIL and HAGGARD who are only jus clear, hit the deck, covering their heads. MOSES is knock off his feet as flaming wood and debris rain down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Punch it!

The RV roars into life, reversing out onto the road. CLIV pulls a spectacular U-turn, sending the passengers flying GRAHAM lands in TARA's arms, RUTH in PAUL's. RUTH and GRA exchange glances. Dumb luck. TARA straightens herself and looks out of the RV at her destroyed home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My weed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL is blackened and dazed, draped over HAGGARD's should His eyes focus on a figure in the near distance. MOSES BE picks himself up and lumbers off towards his truck. HAGGA drops ZOIL and runs to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit Haggard, wait! HAGGARD takes off. ZOIL staggers to his car and with grea difficulty, takes off in pursuit, narrowly avoiding MOSES BEHE's truck. Lightening flashes. Loud thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE floors it. RAIN lashes down. The sky is almost blac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad's persistent, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea. CLIVE sees their pursuers in his wing mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GO LEFT
dialogues.text: CLIVE hauls the wheel left. The RV leaves the road and bounces across the scrub. TEAM PAUL hang on for dear life

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAGGARD, ZOIL and MOSES follow the RV across the scrub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doing?!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Zoil. Progress report!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In pursuit, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggard, sir. Agent Zoil has been compromised. I'm assuming command.

dialogues.speaker: ZOIL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Now wait a goddamn minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit who's in command. Where' my fucking mooncoon?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just ahead of me sir. We're heading East across scrubland just North of Mitchell Creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna hear from either of you jokers until that little mother fucker is under glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir! HAGGARD floors it. He is manic and wild eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the chase from above, the RV is in the lead, gaini behind them, is HAGGARD, followed by ZOIL, then MOSES. HAGGARD draws level. He looks up into CLIVE's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to overtake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him get past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I ram him?

dialogues.speaker: YES
dialogues.text: CLIVE wrenches the wheel hard to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV nudges the BLACK SEDAN which spins out of control skids to a stop, ZOIL and MOSES scream past. HAGGARD turn the engine over. Nothing. He yells. Lightening explodes overhead, hail pings and bounces off the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immense pressure and temperature drop. High winds, circulating in the troposphere, two opposed fronts clashing. Oh, this is going to be a good one.

dialogues.speaker: A GOOD WHAT
dialogues.text: RUTH stares out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive black funnel extends from the sky about half a ahead of the chase. It rakes the ground, reducing a small farm building to a million splinters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL is sat mouth agape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIVE swerves to avoid a grain silo, which comes bouncing across the ground toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you know what you're doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, we'll get sucked right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on target. A branch smacks on the windshield, cracking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grain silo bounces close to ZOIL's car, he swerves to avoid it and stops. MOSES pulls up just ahead. MOSES and get out of the vehicles, almost unable to stand against t wind and debris. They watch the RV, now a good distance i front, heading for the heart of the tornado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's insane!

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: HAGGARD's car screams past. ZOIL grabs his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggard, stand down. Stand down!

dialogues.speaker: HAGGARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: He's mine. I can do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggard, it's suicide.

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: The funnel suddenly evaporates into the sky, leaving the ahead clear and oddly calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL watches amazed. He almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! ZOIL looks at the sky. His face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggard. Wait a minute! An engine revs nearby. ZOIL turns to see MOSES BEHE pull in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEHE
dialogues.text: (into is radio) Damnit, hang back, hang back!

dialogues.speaker: HAGGARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You're not running this show any more Zoil. You had your chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggard, he knows what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: So do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth, why don't you count back from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back where I'm from, tornadoes are part of our daily life. We've learnt how to live with them, how to understand them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gaining!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've learnt to anticipate their behavior, know their personalities, know when they're playing games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What games?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide and seek?
CLIVE looks into his wing mirror, just as the tornado sna down out of the sky between them and HAGGARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great Caesar's ghost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you do that? How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evolution baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tornado touches down hear HAGGARD's car. He barely ha time to scream before his is lifted into the vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide eyed MOSES yanks hard on the wheel, spinning the t round, heading back in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSES's truck hurtles past ZOIL's car.

dialogues.speaker: MOSES BEHE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus! Oh Jesus! Oh Jesus! ZOIL looks back toward the no unreachable RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost them. TEAM PAUL erupt into cheers. PAUL jumps in the air and whoops. He high five GRAHAM and pats CLIVE on the back. GRAHAM embraces RUTH and tries to kiss her, she pulls awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what about Papa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only saw one car following us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Tara? TARA comes out of the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bulb's gone in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was just awesome. Amazing driving Clive. It was like G.T.A. but potentially fatal. Wasn't it, Clive? Clive? A knocking and a gurgling sound is coming from the engine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV splutters to a halt. Steam rises from the radiator whines, coughs and dies. Cut to TEAM PAUL stood around surveying their fallen companion. A single bullet hold in grill, reveals the cause of her downfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes the deposit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fare thee well friend. You were a faithful and mighty steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rode that storm with a bullet in her heart and didn't stop until we we're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is a benevolent creator watching over everything then may he, she or it bless the 1985 Holiday Rambler, Imperial. Everyone looks to PAUL for his comment but he is not ther

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We're here. PAUL is stood away from the RV at the foot of a small hil He starts to climb. The others follow. Crane up as TEAM P climb the hill to reveal a sight familiar to anyone who h seen Close Encounters Of The Third Kind... DEVIL's TOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL drives. Scanning the landscape. Searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoil! What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got hit by a twister, sir. Haggard's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the other one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost him when the ranch exploded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Zoil, this has been one fuck up after another. I should have handled it myself. I want that little bastard dead by midnight tonight or you'll be working security in a convention centre. Now where's that RV? ZOIL's eyes widen. Parked on the roadside is the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoil? ZOIL? ZOIL is staring at DEVIL'S TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEAM PAUL hike towards the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you may not know is on the outside of the tower they bolted a series of ladders, all the way to the top, put there by William Rogers in 1893. He was the first man to climb the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I climbed up there in 1976. Thought it would make a good site for some UFO spotting. Turns out I wasn't the only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call them IFOs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-thank-you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL opens the trunk of his car. He pulls out a large pis spare ammo and a webbing pack which he slings around his shoulder. He sets off up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEAM PAUL are walking round the tower. As they round the corner the landscape changes, the trees give way to a pie of open pasture flanked by pine forest, the tower opens itself up slightly, a perfect natural amphitheatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. PAUL takes out the firework, Zippo and cigarettes from hi back pack. He lights his last cigarette and takes a drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss these. PAUL takes the firework a little way off and sticks it in ground. He crouches down and lights the touch paper with cigarette, then scampers back to the gang. Beat. The fire rises into the sky. It explodes. The star-burst is massiv and bright red, it illuminates the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait. A light appears in the sky some way off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL runs through the bush, fast, like a wild animal. His face fixed with serious intent, gun in one hand, torch in other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEAM PAUL watch as the ethereal light draws nearer. Spotlights cut through the night, searching beneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOIL leaps a fallen tree. Ahead, through the trees, he se an ethereal glow. He pulls the slide back on his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are really close now. They are accompanied by deep rumble. A very earthly sound. Rotor blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... A HELICOPTER swoops in to land, kicking dust and debris i the air. TEAM PAUL turn back to the woods but are stopped the sight of a torch getting nearer.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Behind them, the HELICOPTER powers down. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whaddya know? Small world. VOICE appears flanked by two faceless, heavily armed SOLDIERS. They level their weapons, just as ZOIL bursts through the trees behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorenzo?! PAUL spins round. We go into slow motion. ZOIL fires. The bullet explodes from the gun, straight at us. Angle on th bullet as it passes in ECU. The shot moves round behind t bullet to reveal PAUL, looking shocked. The bullet whizze past him, slamming into one of the soldiers. ZOIL rolls, coming to rest on one knee. He fires a second shot into the leg of the other soldier who collapses. He leaves his gun at VOICE just as the PILOT bursts from the cockpit. The PILOT fires but misses ZOIL. ZOIL takes out shoulder, spinning him off his feet. VOICE steps forward, holding a smoking gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you! You told him. I should've known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never made a mistake in your life. That's why I put you in charge of this fucking mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my friend! I've known him for twenty years. He introduced me to my wife damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid son of a bitch. In five years, you could have been where I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad, seeing as I'm the one hold'ng all the cards and when I say "cards", I of course mean big fucking gun. VOICE points his gun at PAUL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was pretty easy once we got a fix on the geek-mobile. Wasn't hard to figure out where you were headed. You always did have a flare for the dramatic. PAUL nods, a sad smile creeping across his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. TARA stands in front of PAUL, then RUTH, then GRAHAM then CLIVE, who summons every ounce of bravery in his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be honest with yourself, two scoops. What is it that you think you can possibly bring to the table at this stage in the game? CLIVE reaches beyond his back and produces his KATANA SWO he holds it like a proud Samurai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blind fury. The blade falls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody low grade Turkish alloy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step aside, you fat nerd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham, his this man. CLIVE steps aside. GRAHAM slams his fist into the face of unsuspecting VOICE. He staggers back but rallies quickly, blocking GRAHAM's second blow and delivering a heavy rebu RUTH leaps onto VOICE's back and starts pummeling his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone! VOICE hits out at RUTH. GRAHAM renews his attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone! VOICE throws them off and comes face to face with TARA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave them alone. WHAM! She whacks VOICE across the face with a large stick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not taking him away again. He staggers backwards and falls to the ground, unconsciou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
